Authors:
De-Ping Wei, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Jian-Chu Xu,
Chaiwat To-anun, Saowaluck Tibpromma, Peter E Mortimer, Kevin D. Hyde,
Abdallah M Elgorban, Samantha Karunarathna
Title:
Morphology and multigene phylogeny reveal three novel
entomopathogenic fungi from China & Thailand
Keywords:
insect fungi, Ophiocordycipitaceae, Paraisaria, taxonomy,
Yunnan Province
Abstract:
Abstract: During the field surveys of insect fungi, three
entomopathogenic fungi were collected from Guizhou and Yunnan provinces
in China and Krabi Province in Thailand. Morphological observations
showed these three species share similar characteristics by having
solitary, simple, fleshy stroma, completely immersed perithecia and
cylindrical asci with thickened cap and filiform ascospores that often
disarticulate at maturity. Phylogenetic analysis of combined LSU, SSU,
TEF, RPB1, RPB2 and ITS sequence data together with morphological
characteristics showed that the three entomopathogenic fungi are new
species belong to the genus Paraisaria. The new species were named as
Paraisaria alba and P. arcta and P. rosea. Comprehensive descriptions,
colour photographs and a phylogenetic tree to show the position of the
new species in Ophiocordycipitaceae are provided. A synopsis table and a
key to all treated species of Paraisaria are also included.
